episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and historical facts, including a mishap involving chloroform at the 1930 World Cup, a group of astronomers who chase solar eclipses around the world, an early 20th-century music streaming service using telephones, and the use of sound devices by Australian Aboriginal people to attract emus.

facts.fact: In the 1930 World Cup semi-final between the USA and Argentina, the American medic accidentally chloroformed himself and had to be carried off.
There's a group of astronomers called Solar Wind Sherpas who drag their equipment around the world to watch every single solar eclipse.
In 1906, there was a music streaming service which involved just two people playing keyboards down the telephone.
Australian Aboriginal people sometimes built objects specifically to arouse the curiosity of emus.
